hanzi-su-wiki:
経

Значения

Проходить через; испытывать, переносить; проходить (о времени); (геогр.) долгота; управление, ведение; сутра, священное писание

Мнемоника

Кратчайший путь 圣 челнока в ткани — то под чётными, то под нечётными нитями 糸.

Варианты

經, 经

Японский вариант сутры
rtega_mnemonic:
經經RS
经经		経classic works, warp of a fabric, things running lengthwise, rules, regulations, plan, rule, arrange, pass through, stand, longitude
  • streams under ground 巠 passing through the bedrock like a thread 糸 passing through a bound book with classic works, plans or regulations
  • ⓢ a thread 纟binding a crafted 工 book by entering 入 it
  • holy 圣 silk 糸 cloth with sutras: reading them one passes through various stages of enlightenment
heisig_constituent: sutra, thread, spiderman, spool, clod, toilet paper, crotch, soil, dirt, ground
Keyword_KANJIDIC: sutra, longitude, pass thru, expire, warp
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: сутра, долгота, проходит через, истекают, перекос
koohiiStory1: The word ‘sutra’ literally means a rope or thread that holds things together. Here we see that it is a spool that is holding the threads together.
koohiiStory2: Spiderman is intriqued by some of the positions of the karma sutra, but reluctant to take part in an sutra orgy as he´d have to reveal his soiled underwear.
kunYomi: へ.る、た.つ、たていと、はか.る、のり
jp_example_words:
経緯(いきさつ): details, whole story, sequence of events, particulars, how it started, how things got this way, complications, position
経過(けいか): passage, expiration, progress
経費(けいひ): expenses, cost, outlay
経歴(けいれき): personal history, career
経路(けいろ): course, route, channel
経る(へる): to pass, to elapse, to experience
経営(けいえい): management, administration
経度(けいど): longitude
経由(けいゆ): go by the way, via
神経(しんけい): nerve, sensitivity
経つ(たつ): pass, lapse
経験(けいけん): experience
経済(けいざい): economy
jp_readingExamples: 経費 (けいひ), 経済 (けいざい), 経験 (けいけん), 経る (へ.る)
WaniKani_Kanji_Meaning: Passage of Time, Pass Through, Manage
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Tying a thread to a tombstone each year will help you manage the passage of time. That way you’ll know how many years it has been, since you’ll have one thread for each year to count.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture yourself coming back to the same tombstone each passing year and tying a new thread to it. You're trying to manage these feelings by keeping track of how much time passes.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Dealing with the passage of time can be tough, so after you tie the thread to the tombstone, each year you eat a piece of cake (けい). You already eat cake to mark the passage of time on your birthday, so why not here as well?
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Maybe this is your future tombstone, and eating cake each year is a preemptive celebration of your death day! Ooh, what a spooky theory.
Ru_Meaning: sutra, longitude, pass thru, expire, warp
Ru_Radicals: 又 (опять), 土 (земля), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 糸 (нить)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the thread (糸) passes by the ground again (圣) as time elapses

Name meaning
Nothing.
jīng
яп. вм. 经
Radicals: 糸, 圣  (thread, tombstone)
Meaning Mnemonic
Tying a thread to a tombstone each year will help you manage the passage of time. That way you’ll know how many years it has been, since you’ll have one thread for each year to count.
Picture yourself coming back to the same tombstone each passing year and tying a new thread to it. You're trying to manage these feelings by keeping track of how much time passes.
Reading Mnemonic
Dealing with the passage of time can be tough, so after you tie the thread to the tombstone, each year you eat a piece of cake (けい). You already eat cake to mark the passage of time on your birthday, so why not here as well?
Maybe this is your future tombstone, and eating cake each year is a preemptive celebration of your death day! Ooh, what a spooky theory.
